The impact assessment concerns situations of

* dehydration: blood ionogram, creatininaemia, CBC
* sepsis: blood gas with lactates, assessment of organ dysfunction ([[Acute diarrhoea and dehydration in infants, children and adults|cf item 286]])

question.title: What is one of the additional tests used to assess the impact of infectious diarrhoea on the health of adults and children?

option_a.title: Urine electrolyte analysis
option_a.description: A test that measures the levels of certain electrolytes in the urine

option_b.title: Blood gas analysis with lactate levels
option_b.description: A test that measures the levels of lactic acid in the blood

option_c.title: Creatinine blood test
option_c.description: A test that measures the level of creatinine in the blood

option_d.title: Complete Blood Count (CBC) with platelet count
option_d.description: A test that measures the levels of different blood cells and platelets

correct_option.title: Blood gas with lactates
correct_option.description: A test that measures the levels of lactic acid in the blood
